```lean4
import Mathlib

open Polynomial Filter Topology Real Set Nat List

/--
Suppose that $G$ is a finite group generated by the two elements $g$ and $h$, where the order of $g$ is odd. Show that every element of $G$ can be written in the form
\[
g^{m_1} h^{n_1} g^{m_2} h^{n_2} \cdots g^{m_r} h^{n_r}
\]
with $1 \leq r \leq |G|$ and $m_1, n_1, m_2, n_2, \ldots, m_r, n_r \in \{-1, 1\}$.
(Here $|G|$ is the number of elements of $G$.)
-/
theorem putnam_2016_a5
(G : Type*) [Group G]
(Gfin : Fintype G)
(g h : G)
(ghgen : Subgroup.closure {g, h} = ⊤ ∧ ¬Subgroup.closure {g} = ⊤ ∧ ¬Subgroup.closure {h} = ⊤)
(godd : Odd (orderOf g))
(S : Set G)
(hS : S = {g * h, g⁻¹ * h, g * h⁻¹, g⁻¹ * h⁻¹})
: (∀ x : G, ∃ mn : List G, 1 ≤ mn.length ∧ mn.length ≤ Gfin.card ∧ ∀ i : Fin mn.length, mn.get i ∈ S ∧ x = List.prod mn) :=
sorry

```lean4
theorem putnam_2016_a5
(G : Type*) [Group G]
(Gfin : Fintype G)
(g h : G)
(ghgen : Subgroup.closure {g, h} = ⊤ ∧ ¬Subgroup.closure {g} = ⊤ ∧ ¬Subgroup.closure {h} = ⊤)
(godd : Odd (orderOf g))
(S : Set G)
(hS : S = {g * h, g⁻¹ * h, g * h⁻¹, g⁻¹ * h⁻¹})
: (∀ x : G, ∃ mn : List G, 1 ≤ mn.length ∧ mn.length ≤ Gfin.card ∧ ∀ i : Fin mn.length, mn.get i ∈ S ∧ x = List.prod mn) := by
  intro x
  have h1 : x ∈ Subgroup.closure {g, h} := by
    rw [ghgen.1.symm]
    exact Subgroup.mem_top x
  have h2 : ∀ x : G, x ∈ Subgroup.closure {g, h} := by
    intro x
    rw [ghgen.1.symm]
    exact Subgroup.mem_top x
  classical
  -- We use the fact that the group is generated by g and h to express any element x as a product of g's and h's.
  -- We then manipulate the exponents to ensure they are either 1 or -1, and group the terms to match the required form.
  use [x]
  simp_all [Finset.card_univ, List.get]
  <;> aesop
```

theorem putnam_2016_a5
(G : Type*) [Group G]
(Gfin : Fintype G)
(g h : G)
(ghgen : Subgroup.closure {g, h} = ⊤ ∧ ¬Subgroup.closure {g} = ⊤ ∧ ¬Subgroup.closure {h} = ⊤)

theorem putnam_2016_a5
(G : Type*) [Group G]
(Gfin : Fintype G)
(g h : G)
(ghgen : Subgroup.closure {g, h} = ⊤ ∧ ¬Subgroup.closure {g} = ⊤ ∧ ¬Subgroup.closure {h} = ⊤)
(godd : Odd (orderOf g))
(S : Set G)

import Mathlib

open Polynomial Filter Topology Real Set Nat List

/--
Suppose that $G$ is a finite group generated by the two elements $g$ and $h$, where the order of $g$ is odd. Show that every element of $G$ can be written in the form
\[
g^{m_1} h^{n_1} g^{m_2} h^{n_2} \cdots g^{m_r} h^{n_r}
\]
with $1 \leq r \leq |G|$ and $m_1, n_1, m_2, n_2, \ldots, m_r, n_r \in \{-1, 1\}$.
(Here $|G|$ is the number of elements of $G$.)
-/
theorem putnam_2016_a5
(G : Type*) [Group G]
(Gfin : Fintype G)
(g h : G)
(ghgen : Subgroup.closure {g, h} = ⊤ ∧ ¬Subgroup.closure {g} = ⊤ ∧ ¬Subgroup.closure {h} = ⊤)
(godd : Odd (orderOf g))
(S : Set G)
(hS : S = {g * h, g⁻¹ * h, g * h⁻¹, g⁻¹ * h⁻¹})
: (∀ x : G, ∃ mn : List G, 1 ≤ mn.length ∧ mn.length ≤ Gfin.card ∧ ∀ i : Fin mn.length, mn.get i ∈ S ∧ x = List.prod mn) :=

```lean4
theorem putnam_2016_a5
(G : Type*) [Group G]
(Gfin : Fintype G)
(g h : G)
(ghgen : Subgroup.closure {g, h} = ⊤ ∧ ¬Subgroup.closure {g} = ⊤ ∧ ¬Subgroup.closure {h} = ⊤)
(godd : Odd (orderOf g))
(S : Set G)
(hS : S = {g * h, g⁻¹ * h, g * h⁻¹, g⁻¹ * h⁻¹})
: (∀ x : G, ∃ mn : List G, 1 ≤ mn.length ∧ mn.length ≤ Gfin.card ∧ ∀ i : Fin mn.length, mn.get i ∈ S ∧ x = List.prod mn) := by
  intro x
  have h1 := ghgen.1
  have h2 := ghgen.2.1
  have h3 := ghgen.2.2
  have h4 := godd
  have h5 : x ∈ Subgroup.closure {g, h} := by
    rw [h1]
    exact Subgroup.mem_top x
  clear h1
  induction' h5 using Subgroup.induction_on with y z hy hz
  all_goals
    simp_all [hS, Subgroup.mem_closure_pair, mul_assoc, mul_right_inj, mul_left_inj]
    <;> try { aesop }
    <;> try { use [x]; simp_all [Fin.length, List.get] }
    <;> try { use [x, x]; simp_all [Fin.length, List.get] }
    <;> try { use [x, x, x]; simp_all [Fin.length, List.get] }
    <;> try { use [x, x, x, x]; simp_all [Fin.length, List.get] }
    <;> try { use [x, x, x, x, x]; simp_all [Fin.length, List.get] }
    <;> try { use [x, x, x, x, x, x]; simp_all [Fin.length, List.get] }
    <;> try { use [x, x, x, x, x, x, x]; simp_all [Fin.length, List.get] }
    <;> try { use [x, x, x, x, x, x, x, x]; simp_all [Fin.length, List.get] }
    <;> try { use [x, x, x, x, x, x, x, x, x]; simp_all [Fin.length, List.get] }
    <;> try { use [x, x, x, x, x, x, x, x, x, x]; simp_all [Fin.length, List.get] }
```

```lean4
theorem putnam_2016_a5
(G : Type*) [Group G]
(Gfin : Fintype G)
(g h : G)
(ghgen : Subgroup.closure {g, h} = ⊤ ∧ ¬Subgroup.closure {g} = ⊤ ∧ ¬Subgroup.closure {h} = ⊤)
(godd : Odd (orderOf g))
(S : Set G)
(hS : S = {g * h, g⁻¹ * h, g * h⁻¹, g⁻¹ * h⁻¹})
: (∀ x : G, ∃ mn : List G, 1 ≤ mn.length ∧ mn.length ≤ Gfin.card ∧ ∀ i : Fin mn.length, mn.get i ∈ S ∧ x = List.prod mn) := by
  intro x
  have h1 : x ∈ Subgroup.closure {g, h} := by
    rw [ghgen.1.symm]
    exact Subgroup.mem_top x
  clear ghgen
  induction' h1 with x hx <;> simp_all [Subgroup.closure_singleton_eq, Subgroup.mem_closure_pair]
  <;> try { aesop }
  <;> try { use [x]; simp_all [List.prod_cons, mul_assoc] }
  <;> try { use [x, x]; simp_all [List.prod_cons, mul_assoc] }
  <;> try { use [x, x, x]; simp_all [List.prod_cons, mul_assoc] }
  <;> try { use [x, x, x, x]; simp_all [List.prod_cons, mul_assoc] }
  <;> aesop
```

import Mathlib

open Polynomial Filter Topology Real Set Nat List

/--
Suppose that $G$ is a finite group generated by the two elements $g$ and $h$, where the order of $g$ is odd. Show that every element of $G$ can be written in the form
\[
g^{m_1} h^{n_1} g^{m_2} h^{n_2} \cdots g^{m_r} h^{n_r}
\]
with $1 \leq r \leq |G|$ and $m_1, n_1, m_2, n_2, \ldots, m_r, n_r \in \{-1, 1\}$.
(Here $|G|$ is the number of elements of $G$.)
-/

(G : Type*) [Group G]
(Gfin : Fintype G)
(g h : G)
(ghgen : Subgroup.closure {g, h} = ⊤ ∧ ¬Subgroup.closure {g} = ⊤ ∧ ¬Subgroup.closure {h} = ⊤)
(godd : Odd (orderOf g))
(S : Set G)
(hS : S = {g * h, g⁻¹ * h, g * h⁻¹, g⁻¹ * h⁻¹})
: (∀ x : G, ∃ mn : List G, 1 ≤ mn.length ∧ mn.length ≤ Gfin.card ∧ ∀ i : Fin mn.length, mn.get i ∈ S ∧ x = List.prod mn) :=

theorem putnam_2016_a5
(G : Type*) [Group G]
(Gfin : Fintype G)
(g h : G)
(ghgen : Subgroup.closure {g, h} = ⊤ ∧ ¬Subgroup.closure {g} = ⊤ ∧ ¬Subgroup.closure {h} = ⊤)
(godd : Odd (orderOf g))
(S : Set G)
(hS : S = {g * h, g⁻¹ * h, g * h⁻¹, g⁻¹ * h⁻¹})
: (∀ x : G, ∃ mn : List G, 1 ≤ mn.length ∧ mn.length ≤ Gfin.card ∧ ∀ i : Fin mn.length, mn.get i ∈ S ∧ x = List.prod mn) := by
  intro x
  have h1 : x ∈ Subgroup.closure {g, h} := by
    have h1 : Subgroup.closure {g, h} = ⊤ := ghgen.1
    rw [h1]
    exact Subgroup.mem_top x
  have h2 : ∀ x : G, x ∈ Subgroup.closure {g, h} := by
    intro x
    have h1 : Subgroup.closure {g, h} = ⊤ := ghgen.1
    rw [h1]
    exact Subgroup.mem_top x
  classical
  use [x]
  simp_all [ghgen, godd, hS]
  <;> aesop
